result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric John ALAPERET was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric John ALAPERET

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The State files an Amended Information which amends the charge to disorderly conduct, contrary to Section 947.01(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
GUILTY plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The Court comments and imposes a $50.00 fine plus costs, total of $516.00, to be paid by 11-17-14 or 9 days county jail for failure to pay.
Amended Information.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.
Plea and sentencing hearing is reset to 09-17-14 at 3:00 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 09-17-14 at 9:45 a.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Court notes the signature line of the complaint hasn't been signed.  Court has the DA sign the signature line.  Defense counsel is okay with this.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-05-14 at 2:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-06-14 at 2:15 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recogizance bond with the condition that defendant is to have no contact with Carl Berger.  Bail furnished.  
Minutes.

RE:  Carl Berger, on 06-13-14.
Initial appearance is set for 07-28-14 at 2:30 p.m.
